experiment.name: Expression data of Col:LUC Arabidopsis treated with antimycin A (AA) in the presence or absence of a synthetic auxin analogue

description.text: Mitochondrial stress stimuli such as AA caused a transient suppression of auxin signaling and conversely, auxin treatment represses a part of the response to AA treatment. Expression data of Col:LUC Arabidopsis treated with antimycin A (AA) in the presence or absence of a synthetic auxin analogue Total RNA extraction was carried out on 80 mg of  Col:LUC Arabidopsis seedlings grown on B5 media for 10 days and transferred to fresh plates, containing either B5 media or B5 media supplemented with 4.5 µM NAA for an additional 3 days. Seedlings were treated with 50 µM AA for 3 hours.

bibliography.authors: Ivanova A, Law SR, Narsai R, Duncan O, Lee JH, Zhang B, Van Aken O, Radomiljac JD, van der Merwe M, Yi K, Whelan J
bibliography.title: A Functional Antagonistic Relationship between Auxin and Mitochondrial Retrograde Signaling Regulates Alternative Oxidase1a Expression in Arabidopsis

experimentalvariable.name: treatment
value: 4.5 micromolar Naphtalenacetic acid and 50 micromolar antimycin A
